e4: Adopting the new policy ensures accuracy and integrity in financial reporting, fostering long-term trust and credibility for ABC. While short-term misunderstandings may arise among investors accustomed to adjusting earnings, transparency aligns with industry best practices and reduces legal risks associated with biased representation. It empowers investors with clear data.
e5: An ethical reporting policy is transparent, consistently discloses information truthfully, and maintains integrity, preventing any intentional misrepresentation that could lead investors to make uninformed decisions. It also ensures accessibility and clarity for not just sophisticated investors but all stakeholders, emphasizing fair treatment. Regulatory compliance and fostering long-lasting trust should guide policy characteristics, ensuring that all context-sensitive factors, like industry practices or investor expectations, are balanced for fairness and transparency.
e6: Yes, some follow-up questions include: How will the change in policy be communicated to all investors to minimize misunderstanding? What steps will be taken to transition smoothly and maintain investor confidence? Are there contingency plans in case legal or financial complications arise during the policy switch?
